name: undependable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be trusted and not likely to do what you expect: Electricity is so undependable that lights go out in the capital several times a day. A harsh aspect of poverty is that income is often irregular and undependable.
More examplesFewer examplesThese measures might help to regulate the problem of undependable supplies of food in cities.The past is gone and my memory of it is undependable.Not only is the evidence scarce, it is also often undependable.
